Sentencas: Flat-tube solid oxide fuel cells (FT-SOFCs) are advantageous because of their easy sealing, low stack volume and low resistance to current collection.
Titulo: Computational analysis of operating temperature, hydrogen flow rate and anode thickness in anode-supported flat-tube solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The performance of FT-SOFCs is determined by the electrochemical reaction, which is closely linked to the heat and mass transfer inside the cell.
Titulo: Computational analysis of operating temperature, hydrogen flow rate and anode thickness in anode-supported flat-tube solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Therefore, both the electrochemical reaction and the transport phenomena are investigated in this study using a numerical approach.
Titulo: Computational analysis of operating temperature, hydrogen flow rate and anode thickness in anode-supported flat-tube solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Numerical results are evaluated by physical property models, governing equations and electrochemical reaction models.
Titulo: Computational analysis of operating temperature, hydrogen flow rate and anode thickness in anode-supported flat-tube solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: After simulation, the results are compared with experimental data for code validation, and the current density and the temperature are presented as numerical results.
Titulo: Computational analysis of operating temperature, hydrogen flow rate and anode thickness in anode-supported flat-tube solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The FT-SOFC performance improves with a higher operating temperature due to the activated electrochemical reaction.
Titulo: Computational analysis of operating temperature, hydrogen flow rate and anode thickness in anode-supported flat-tube solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: If the cell support is thickened in order to achieve higher mechanical strength, the mass transfer rate is reduced and the ohmic polarization increases.
Titulo: Computational analysis of operating temperature, hydrogen flow rate and anode thickness in anode-supported flat-tube solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: These phenomena can lower the performance.
Titulo: Computational analysis of operating temperature, hydrogen flow rate and anode thickness in anode-supported flat-tube solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Increasing the amount of hydrogen provides a higher mass transfer rate; therefore, the FT-SOFC can obtain a higher and a more uniform current density distribution.
Titulo: Computational analysis of operating temperature, hydrogen flow rate and anode thickness in anode-supported flat-tube solid oxide fuel cells
